title: Greater China
summary: "Greater China" is an informal geographical area that shares commercial and cultural ties with the Han Chinese,[1][2][3] The notion of "Greater China" refers to the area that usually encompasses Mainland China, Hong Kong, Macau, and Taiwan in East Asia.[4][5][6] Some analysts may also include places which have predominantly ethnic Chinese population such as Singapore. The term can be generalised to encompass "linkages among regional Chinese communities".[7][8]
